ResParameters.Name: resourceType
ResParameters.Description: The resource type to autoscale; only

ResParameters.Name: thresholdPeriodMinutes
ResParameters.Description: Duration the resource must be at min/max in order to autoscale (5, 10, 15, or 30 minutes)

ResParameters.Name: scaleUpIncrement
ResParameters.Description: Number of CPU to increase on a scale up event (1, 2, or 4)

ResParameters.Name: range
ResParameters.Description: The range defining the minimum and maximum number of CPU to allow (between 1-16)

ResParameters.Name: scaleUpThreshold
ResParameters.Description: Will scale up when resource it at this setting for at least the threshold period (between 1-100)

ResParameters.Name: scaleDownThreshold
ResParameters.Description: Will scale down when resource it at this setting for at least the threshold period (between 1-100)

ResParameters.Name: scaleDownWindow
ResParameters.Description: A server reboot is required for all resource scale downs; this is the scale down window during which the resource will be set to the policy's minimum value.

ContentParameters.Name: ports
ContentParameters.Description: The set of ports and protocols to allow access to for the new public IP address. Only these specified ports on the respective protocols will be accessible when accessing the server using the public IP address claimed here.

ContentParameters.Name: sourceRestrictions
ContentParameters.Description: The source IP address range allowed to access the new public IP address. Used to restrict access to only the specified range of source IPs.

UrlParameters.Name: AccountAlias
UrlParameters.Description: Short code for a particular account

ContentParameters.Name: name
ContentParameters.Description: Name of the server to create. Alphanumeric characters and dashes only. Must be between 1-8 characters depending on the length of the account alias. The combination of account alias and server name here must be no more than 10 characters in length. (This name will be appended with a two digit number and prepended with the datacenter code and account alias to make up the final server name.)

ContentParameters.Name: description
ContentParameters.Description: User-defined description of this server

ContentParameters.Name: groupId
ContentParameters.Description: ID of the parent group. Retrieved from query to parent group, or by looking at the URL on the UI pages in the Control Portal.

ContentParameters.Name: sourceServerId
ContentParameters.Description: ID of the server to use a source. May be the ID of a template, or when cloning, an existing server ID. The list of available templates for a given account in a data center can be retrieved from the

ContentParameters.Name: isManagedOS
ContentParameters.Description: Whether to create the server as managed or not. Default is false. (Ignored for bare metal servers.)

ContentParameters.Name: isManagedBackup
ContentParameters.Description: Whether to add managed backup to the server. Must be a managed OS server. (Ignored for bare metal servers.)

ContentParameters.Name: primaryDns
ContentParameters.Description: Primary DNS to set on the server. If not supplied the default value set on the account will be used.

ContentParameters.Name: secondaryDns
ContentParameters.Description: Secondary DNS to set on the server. If not supplied the default value set on the account will be used.

ContentParameters.Name: networkId
ContentParameters.Description: ID of the network to which to deploy the server. If not provided, a network will be chosen automatically. If your account has not yet been assigned a network, leave this blank and one will be assigned automatically. The list of available networks for a given account in a data center can be retrieved from the

ContentParameters.Name: ipAddress
ContentParameters.Description: IP address to assign to the server. If not provided, one will be assigned automatically. (Ignored for bare metal servers.)

ContentParameters.Name: password
ContentParameters.Description: Password of administrator or root user on server. If not provided, one will be generated automatically.

ContentParameters.Name: sourceServerPassword
ContentParameters.Description: Password of the source server, used only when creating a clone from an existing server. (Ignored for bare metal servers.)

ContentParameters.Name: cpu
ContentParameters.Description: Number of processors to configure the server with (1-16) (ignored for bare metal servers)

ContentParameters.Name: cpuAutoscalePolicyId
ContentParameters.Description: ID of the vertical CPU Autoscale policy to associate the server with. Available IDs can be retrieved from the

ContentParameters.Name: memoryGB
ContentParameters.Description: Number of GB of memory to configure the server with (1-128) (ignored for bare metal servers)

ContentParameters.Name: type
ContentParameters.Description: Whether to create a standard, hyperscale or bareMetal server

ContentParameters.Name: antiAffinityPolicyId
ContentParameters.Description: ID of the Anti-Affinity policy to associate the server with. Only valid for hyperscale servers. Available IDs can be retrieved from the

ContentParameters.Name: customFields
ContentParameters.Description: Collection of custom field ID-value pairs to set for the server.

Children.Name: id
Children.Description: ID of the custom field to set. Available custom field IDs can be retrieved from the

Children.Name: value
Children.Description: Value to set the custom field to for this server.

ContentParameters.Name: additionalDisks
ContentParameters.Description: Collection of disk parameters (ignored for bare metal servers)

Children.Name: path
Children.Description: File system path for disk (Windows drive letter or Linux mount point). Must not be one of reserved names.

Children.Name: sizeGB
Children.Description: Amount in GB to allocate for disk, up to 1024 GB per.

Children.Name: type
Children.Description: Whether the disk should be raw or partitioned

ContentParameters.Name: ttl
ContentParameters.Description: Date/time that the server should be deleted (ignored for bare metal servers)

ContentParameters.Name: packages
ContentParameters.Description: Collection of packages to run on the server after it has been built (ignored for bare metal servers)

Children.Name: packageId
Children.Description: ID of the package to run on the server after it builds. Available package IDs can be retrieved from the

Children.Name: parameters
Children.Description: Collection of name-value pairs to specify package-specific parameters.

ContentParameters.Name: configurationId
ContentParameters.Description: Only required for bare metal servers. Specifies the identifier for the specific configuration type of bare metal server to deploy. A list of possible configs can be retrieved from the

ContentParameters.Name: osType
ContentParameters.Description: Only required for bare metal servers. Specifies the OS to provision with the bare metal server. Currently, the only supported OS types are
